intro: Fagara beniensis, commonly known as the Benin fagara, is a tropical shrub native to western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces elliptical, smooth-skinned fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
